net.sf.mmm.search.engine.impl.lucene

Class LuceneSearchEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.engine.base.AbstractSearchEngine
        • net.sf.mmm.search.engine.impl.lucene.LuceneSearchEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, ManagedSearchEngine, SearchEngine, Refreshable

    public class LuceneSearchEngine
extends AbstractSearchEngine
    This is the implementation of the SearchEngine interface using lucene as underlying search-engine.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        searchHighlighter - is used to create the highlighted text.
        Returns:
        the SearchHit.

      • search

        public SearchResultPage search(SearchQuery query,
                               int hitsPerPage)
        This method performs an initial search for a given query and returns the first SearchResultPage. The hits are in descending order of their score so the best hit is the first hit of the page .
        For getting the results of a following SearchResultPage use SearchEngine.search(SearchQuery, int, int, int).
        Parameters:
        query - is the query of the user that wants to search. Use the query-builder to construct.
        hitsPerPage - is the number of hits per page. See SearchResultPage.DEFAULT_HITS_PER_PAGE.
        Returns:
        the search result page for the given query at the given pageIndex.
        See Also:
        SearchEngine.getQueryBuilder()

      • search

        public SearchResultPage search(SearchQuery query,
                               int hitsPerPage,
                               int pageIndex,
                               int totalHitCount)
        This method performs a search for a subsequent SearchResultPage of an initial search. The hits are in descending order of their score.
        Parameters:
        query - is the query of the user that wants to search. Use the query-builder to construct.
        hitsPerPage - is the number of hits contained in a SearchResultPage. This should be the same value as in the initial search.
        pageIndex - is the page index of the requested search result. For a new query this should initially be 0. After a search result was retrieved by this method, further calls for the same query can be performed with a pageIndex greater than 0 and less than SearchResultPage.getPageCount().
        It can NOT be guaranteed that the pageIndex is always valid in the sense as described above (the search index may have been modified in the meantime). An implementation has to be able to handle calls with a pageIndex greater or equal to SearchResultPage.getPageCount(). The recommended strategy is to return the last page in this case.
        totalHitCount - is the total hit count expected for this query that is already known from the initial search. The implementation has to be able to handle that the search index may have been modified in the meantime and the value is NOT correct anymore. If the implementation can determine the correct total hit-count without performance overhead, it may ignore this parameter.
        Returns:
        the search result page for the given query at the given pageIndex.

      • count

        public long count(String field,
                  String value)
        This method counts the number of SearchEntrys where the given field has the given value. This can be useful for counting the SearchEntrys of a particular source or type. You could also do a search to figure this out but this method is supposed to be much faster.
        Parameters:
        field - is the name of the field.
        value - is the potential value to match.
        Returns:
        the number of matching SearchEntrys.

      • getTotalEntryCount

        public long getTotalEntryCount()
        This method gets the total number of SearchEntrys in the search-index.
        Returns:
        the total number of SearchEntrys.

      • getEntry

        public SearchEntry getEntry(String entryId)
        This method gets a entry by its technical entry-ID.
        This method may be useful for getting details of a hit in a new request (without rerunning the search).
        Parameters:
        entryId - is the ID of the requested entry.
        Returns:
        the entry with the given id or null if no such entry is available.

      • getEntry

        public SearchEntry getEntry(int documentId)
        Parameters:
        documentId - is the technical ID of the lucene Document representing the hit.
        Returns:
        the document as SearchEntry.
        See Also:
        getEntry(String)

      • refresh

        public boolean refresh()
        This method tells the search-engine to refresh explicitly. Depending on the implementation this may cause that the search index is reread from the disk or that caches are purged. The implementation is expected to be smart in a way that it only rebuilds things if things really have changed since creation or the last call of ManagedSearchEngine.refresh().
        This can be an expensive operation and should NOT be called per search request. This method refreshes the given object. This can be anything from reloading configuration to rebuilding the internal state. An invocation of this method may be expensive and should only be invoked as needed. The implementation of this method should be thread-safe if the object itself is to be used by separate consumers at all.
        Returns:
        true if something has changed, false otherwise. If the implementation can not determine the change it should return true.

      • close

        public void close()
        This method disposes the search-engine. This method needs to be called when the search-engine is NOT used anymore. It will free used resources (e.g. close streams, etc.). After the call of this method this search-engine AND all results retrieved from this search-engine can NOT be used anymore.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface ManagedSearchEngine
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractSearchEngine
